key_points: Tom Brady led the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to a 28-22 victory over the Philadelphia Eagles.
Brady passed for two touchdowns and Leonard Fournette rushed for two touchdowns.
Antonio Brown and O.J. Howard caught scoring passes from Brady.
Brady completed 34 of 42 passes for 297 yards, despite a recent thumb injury.
Jalen Hurts scored two rushing touchdowns and one passing touchdown for the Eagles.
The Buccaneers improved their record to 5-1, and the Eagles dropped to 2-4.
Philadelphia's Anthony Harris ended Brady's franchise record of 227 passes without an interception.
The Buccaneers dominated in yardage, gaining 399 yards to the Eagles' 213.
Fournette scored twice and had a total of 81 rushing yards and 46 receiving yards.
Philadelphia's comeback attempt was halted as Tampa Bay controlled possession late in the game.
